nodes.title: Nest.js
nodes.desc: A progressive Node.js framework for building efficient, scalable Node.js server-side applications. [More Info](https://nestjs.com/)

nodes.title: Node.js
nodes.desc: An open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a web browser. [More Info](https://nodejs.org/en/)

nodes.title: Guards
nodes.desc: Used to protect routes from unauthorized access in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/guards)

nodes.title: Pipes
nodes.desc: Used to transform and validate data in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/pipes)

nodes.title: Microservices
nodes.desc: An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of small, independent services in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/microservices)

nodes.title: WebSockets
nodes.desc: A protocol that enables bidirectional, real-time communication between a client and a server in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/websockets)

nodes.title: GraphQL
nodes.desc: A query language for APIs that allows clients to specify exactly what data they need in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/graphql)

nodes.title: REST
nodes.desc: An architectural style for designing networked applications that emphasizes simplicity, flexibility, and scalability in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/controllers#rest-controllers)

nodes.title: JavaScript
nodes.desc: A high-level, dynamic, and interpreted programming language that is primarily used for client-side scripting on the web. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript)

nodes.title: TypeScript
nodes.desc: A superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing and other features to improve the development experience. [More Info](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)

nodes.title: Dependency Injection
nodes.desc: A software design pattern that allows components to be loosely coupled, making it easier to test, maintain, and extend the system. [More Info](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dependency_injection)

nodes.title: Modules
nodes.desc: Self-contained pieces of code that represent a single unit of functionality in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/modules)

nodes.title: Controllers
nodes.desc: Handle incoming requests and return responses to the client in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/controllers)

nodes.title: Services
nodes.desc: Used to encapsulate business logic and provide a way to interact with the data storage layer in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/providers)

nodes.title: Providers
nodes.desc: Used to provide a way to inject dependencies into components in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/providers)

nodes.title: Interceptors
nodes.desc: Used to intercept and modify incoming requests and outgoing responses in a Nest.js application. [More Info](https://docs.nestjs.com/interceptors)
